name: misplace
content:

Add to word list
C2 to lose something temporarily by forgetting where you have put it: She misplaced her keys so often that her secretary used to carry spare ones for her. Synonyms
lose (NOT HAVE)
mislay

to lose something, esp. temporarily, by forgetting where you put it: I am always misplacing my eyeglasses.
